meanings.definition: Capable of being forced or compelled.
meanings.sent1: The lock was forceable with a strong kick.
meanings.sent2: The contract was forceable once signed by both parties.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn jar finally gave in to the forceable twist.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as forceable as a raging river.
meanings.sent5: The idea of justice was made more forceable by the presence of law enforcement.

meanings.definition: Able to be enforced or carried out by force.
meanings.sent1: The new rule was forceable by the security team.
meanings.sent2: The court order was forceable by the police if necessary.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat found the forceable boundaries of the invisible fence.
meanings.sent4: The storm's winds were as forceable as a charging bull.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's authority became more forceable after the principal's visit.
